question.content:
**Mark all the relative *minimum* points in the graph.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

hints.content: A relative minimum point is a point that is lower than all other graph points around it. It's like the lowest point on a "valley."

The graph has three relative minimum points in the given section. One at $(-6,-7)$, one at $(-1,-2)$, and one at $(3,-2)$.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate plane. The x- and y-axes each scale by one. A continuous function decreases from the point negative eight, negative five to the point negative six, negative seven. Then it increases to the point negative four, four. Then it decreases to the point negative one, negative two. Then it increases to the point one, six. Then it decreases to the point three, negative two. Then it increases to the point five, six. Then it decreases to the point eight, five. There are points plotted on the curve at negative six, negative seven, negative one, negative two, and three, negative two.
